metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11811 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.4. There is ause-after-free upon attempted read access to /proc/ioports after theipmi_si module is removed, related to drivers/char/ipmi/ipmi_si_intf.c,drivers/char/ipmi/ipmi_si_mem_io.c, anddrivers/char/ipmi/ipmi_si_port_io.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11811` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
